DOC.brief_summary: Air pollution global environmental health concern , contribute onset deterioration respiratory cardiovascular disease . As climate change dependence diminish fossil fuel supply take center stage political scientific debate , renewable carbon-neutral fuel like biodiesel receive increase attention . The common biodiesel within European Union , rapeseed oil methyl ester ( RME ) perceive `` green fuel '' , sustainable biological origin , therefore often predict less harmful human health . Whilst replace petrodiesel biodiesel may advantageous ecological impact , consequence respiratory health remain largely unexplored . The purpose current study evaluate whether inhalation 100 % RME biodiesel exhaust would result acute airway inflammatory response healthy human subject , show previously follow exposure petrodiesel exhaust .
